ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: River Research Centre started the activities in 2003 It was registered as a Trust in 2006 As the name suggests the main focus of the organization is the river conservation Also we look into issues related with water resources forest ecology agriculture energy conservation tribal affairs and environment education activities We also do research campaigns and policy level advocacy works We are coordinating with Local Self Governments of Chalakudy River basin on water management and river conservation Some of the important activities taken up by RRC is listed below Study on the multi basin inter state Parambikulam Aliyar Project Study on water drawal by lift irrigation systems in Chalakudy River basin Study on water use by plantations in Nelliyampathy Acted as Project Facilitating Agency in a NABARD funded Watershed project at Bedadka Gram Panchayath in Kasargode District Coordinated a project for Fish monitoring in Kerala rivers for the Kerala State Biodiversity Board Did river bank mapping and sand auditing of two rivers for the Revenue Department of Government of Kerala Did a short review of solar policy implementation in Kerala Doing Schools for River program to inculcate love for rivers among students Carrying out the Project Sustainable livelihood program for ethnic communities around Parambikulam Tiger Reserve funded by Science and Technology Department of Government of India Apart from these we have been providing policy inputs to various ministries at State and Centre

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Grant was routed through Keystone Foundation since RRC did not have the document 12 A

Introducing smokeless chulha and biomass briquetting as sustainable, environment and human
Continuing the work being carried out with indigenous women on enterprise building and forest nursery management

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sevakiran Charitable Society was established in 2011 at Kothamangalam Thaluk, Ernakulam District and registered under the Travancore  Cochin Literacy Scientific ad Societies Act XII of 1955. Sevakiran Charitable Society is a voluntary organization taking initiatives, responsibilities, and leadership for implementing various Social Projects and rendering services to the society and individuals with a holistic approach for the Self-Empowerment in the areas of Education, Health, and Self-Employment, agriculture etc. Various initiatives of Sevakiran; CHILD DEVELOPMENT(Pragathi Balabavan) - A project to Empower Students from socially /financially Marginalized, by supporting and facilitating them for education and other basic Needs. Sanjeevani Blood Bank - Sanjeevani blood bank is forum volunteered by citizens and donating blood to all those required Disaster Management Team Fully equipped and trained and experienced team to handle Disaster recovery. Preparedness for Immediate relief, Disaster Risk reduction measure, Awareness programs, Rehabilitation, Health care management and Reconstruction of House and other facilities Individual Skill Development and Entrepreneurship promotion. Mentoring and providing trainings ad support for Individual development. Training and consultation for Entrepreneurship Development Asakiran Counseling Center - Asha Kiran counseling centre is providing free counseling services in various fields like Empowering individuals to solve their own problems By tuning up their relationship with self & others Premarital Counseling Family Relationship Issues Academic Performance Psychopathological Issues Tribal Empowerment Initiatives and Projects for the empowerment for Tribal. Promotion of Organic Farming - Projects and Initiatives for promoting and supporting Organic farming, Group Farming and live stock.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sevanikethan is a non  profit registered organization for the social apostolate under St. Mathews Province, Changanacherry in the Sacred Heart Congregation for women in India. We work for the upliftment of the marginalized and vulnerable section in the community without any discrimination of cast, creed, sex and age through various projects for last 38 years. Our motto is to Love and Serve with the vision of a society where peace and harmony is achieved and sustained. We work with the mission of reaching to Almighty by reach out to environment and fellow being through work with individuals, group, family and community. Under this organization 4 Special Schools are functioning, 3 for Mentally Retarded children and 1 for Deaf and Dumb, a rehabilitation centre for Mentally Challenged women, 4 Rehabilitation centers are functioning for the children from problematic families, child focused community development programs are functioning in various regions in our target areas. It also addresses environment problems by using central Government funds, focused on sponsorship programmes, Income Generating Programmes, women empowerment programs,, capacity building programs for women and children based on their rights. Financial support is given to the marriage of girls form financially backward families. Various programs are conducted for the upliftment of Daliths like professional education, Income Generation Programs, scholarships etc. And we are also providing financial and material assistance for the construction and maintenance of houses for low income families. We conduct various awareness programmes to uplift socially backward community and promoting them to joining various welfare schemes and insurance schemes provided by Government bodies and other NGOs. Many other programmes and project are running successfully against drug abuse, child rights protection, women empowerment etc. Our main areas of intervention includes Education, Health, Geriatric care, Tribal development, Women empowerment, Differently able, Environment, Housing etc Sevanikethan has undertaken a number of programmes for the overall development of all the sections of the society. As an individual who enjoy the privileges of the world it is our commitment to work for its integrity. We could successfully reach out the under privileged and indigenous with the experience of 38 years in the field. Along with our social work activities, we host many programs and training for the public with the support of several departments under State and Central Ministries. Some of the milestones in our history are given under:  Sponsoring students from economically backward families for last 7 years.  Saving Schemes for children to develop their saving habit under the name Ishwarya Project.  Skill training and test is conducting for both Men and Women in association with Textile Ministry of India.  A number of special schools, Balika Bhavans is also functioned by our sister organizations in several parts of India.  Conducting Environmental Awareness Campaign programmes in association with Government (NEAC) for last 5 years.  More than 60 SHGs in different regions of our target areas.  Operating Tribal hostels and Working womens Hostel for their protection and empowerment ensuring their security also.

ngoList.address: Shatkala Govinda Marar Smaraka Kalasamithy, P O Ramamangalam,Kerala 686 663
ngoList.title: Shatkala Govinda Marar Smaraka Kalasamithy
ngoList.actName: Travancore Cochin Literary Scientific and Charitable Societies Regn Act 1955
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have been successful in organising varied cultural activities for the promotion of traditional and classical art forms of Kerala all these years. Intresetingly, this includes resucitating many an art form on the verge of extinction. Parisha Vadyam, the percussion ensemble which is the precursor of Panchavadyam could be reproduced successfully. In this connection, a group of young percussionists were tyrained specifically for this by the only surviving maestro Thrikamburam Krishnankutty Marar. A week-long workshop was held for this. Revival of Thiruvathirakkali, group dance by village women was another major achievement. Training classes for young artistes in music, dance and percussion is a regular programme. Arangettam (debut performance) of many of them could be held on many occasions. We are proud that at least a good number of them have graduated into professional artistes in this areas. Music and dance festivals are regularly held to provide performance ooportunities to them. Such festivals also showcase exponents which serves as a very good exposure to the up-and-coming artistes. Documentation of the rare art forms peculiar to this area is another major achievements. All of them have been preserved in CDs.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shreyas is engaged in building up a new social order with gender and environmental sensitivity based on moral values and principles. The present operational area is divided into 9 Regions incorporating- 83 Units -Village Federations for effective management and active participation. Entering into the 40th year of social service, Shreyas could promote 3000 Community Based Organisations, coordinating 44000 families, covering a total population of two lakh.

A comprehensive tribal development programme having small orchard as the core component (WADI) is being implemented for improving the livelihood of tribal population by Shreyas with the support of NABARD. Shreyas implemented WADI project under NABRAD Tribal Development Fund across Noolpuzha, Nenmeni Gramapanchayaths and Sulthan Bathery Municipality of Wayanad district among 250 families from primitive tribal communities. The tribal communities included were Kattunayka, Urali, Paniya and Kuruma.

Intensive Achievement Motivation (I AM) programs for tribal youth to Promote and Preserves a Traditional, Healthy, and Strong Community for sustainable development of tribal youth in 30 tribal villages of 2 grama panchayaths of Wayanad district. The project mainly focuses on capacity building for tribal youth, Skill development on Pollution Free Poultry Farms and Bio Farming as alternative livelihood options and provides inputs on the rich cultural heritage and traditional customs
